document_data.name: Deleira Truesilver
document_data.mainbody: '''Deleira Truesilver''' was a noble from [[Suzail]] and a lady of the [[Truesilver]] noble house of [[Cormyr]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. She was also a cat burglar and slayer under cover of night, using the alias of '''Talane'''.
document_data.Appearance:
She was lean and lithe. When dealing as Talane, she wore black leathers covering her from head to toe, leaving only eyes and mouth visible.

When without her mask, she had flashing yellow eyes and white hair, looking quite good for her matronly age.
document_data.Abilities: The woman was extremely nimble, moving across walls and ceilings in preternatural ways.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|288|27}}
document_data.Posessions:
Of note, she wielded a sword that seemed to drink away light and quietly emanated something ineffable, but sickening. Her Talane outfit was criscrossed by leather belts scabbarded with nine or more daggers, all of them excellently balanced for throwing. The heel of her boot held an empty space for keys.

The hat she wore to the [[Council of the Dragon]] was magnificent; she traveled in an open carriage there.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|80|9}} The room to which she kept in the evenings had a window open to breezes; she carried a [[dagger]] and pendant of some import, almost certainly magical, there. A balcony on her home had a griffon carved on its east end; directly underneath were her gardens and a patch of soft moss.
document_data.Relationships: She had maids at home. She found fault with her family and servants constantly.
document_data.Activities: As Talane, she was a burglar and slayer.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
Their first meeting had Amarune horrified and on edge for long enough that she almost killed [[Arclath Delcastle]] the next time she saw him.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|175-176|17}} Strangely, Talane didn't turn up at Amarune's home four nights since their first meeting, like she'd promised.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|292-293|28}} During her meet with Elminster, Amarune was told the truth of Talane.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|302|29}} Marlin Stormserpent, too, was questioned about Talane by the [[Purple Dragons]], after his servant Gaskur was found dead.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|304-305|29}} Amarune remained disturbed for a while by Talane's impression.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|310|30}}{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|62|7}}{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|272|29}}

At the time of the Council of the Dragon, word on the street was that she'd been bedridden for some time.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|80|9}}
